result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd M Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Todd M Rivera is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Todd M Rivera was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of three (3) years.

miscConds.notes:
Fine of $600.00, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges, DNA surcharge.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid over period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

$958.40 payable to victim James D.  
The remaining restitution amount requested of $30,000.00 will be determined at hearing on 7/21/15.
07-21-15/ M Joseph Donald
The Court amended the JOC and ordered "additional" restitution in the amount of $5,000.00, payable to the victim, James D., to be paid over the period of Proabtion.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Cooperate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

Provide a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant  that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd M Rivera

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Restitution Refund
Amended JOC reflects 07-21-15 Court order for $5,000.00 additional restitution

Defendant Todd M Rivera in court with attorney Michael H. Kopp.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties have reached an agreement.
Statements made.

COURT'S RULING:  Court AMENDED the Judgment of Conviction and ordered "additional" restitution in the amount of $5,000.00 payable to the victim, James D. - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Todd M Rivera in court with attorney Michael H. Kopp.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS. 
Credit given for 15 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.


COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 2): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 10 MONTHS "condition time" with release privileges for employment, treatment, and medical appointments only.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY fine in the amount of $600.00 - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $958.40 payable to the victim, James D. - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* The remaining restitution amount requested of $30,000.00 will be determined at an upcoming restitution hearing.
* Defendant's driver operating privileges are REVOKED for a period of 3 years.
* Defendant is not to operate any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
* Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignitition interlock device installed for a period of 3 years.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Case adjourned to 07-21-2015 at 10:00 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Restitution Hearing.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.
Crime Victim Impact Statement.

Defendant Todd M Rivera in court with attorney Michael H. Kopp.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Defendant changes plea to "NO CONTEST". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 dismissed outright.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
